newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Telecom seen posting record 96/97 prft - paper.
newsitem.headline: Japan Telecom seen posting record 96/97 prft - paper.

text.p: Japan Telecom Co Ltd is expected to post a record parent current profit for the year to March 31, 1997, but is seen having a 13 percent year-on-year fall in 1997/98, a Japanese newspaper said on Thursday.

The Nihon Keizai Shimbun said the domestic long-distance telecommunications operator is expected to post a parent current profit of about 45 billion yen in 1996/97, up seven percent from the previous year.

A rise in telephone calls more than offset the negative impact from a call rate reduction in February. A cut in access charges that Japan Telecom pays to Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp also helped increase its profit, the paper said.
Japan Telecom's parent current profit will be about 39 billion yen in 1997/98, it predicted.

The impact of its call rate cut in February this year would become apparent in 1997/98, and a planned merger with International Telecom Japan Inc (ITJ) would not help Japan Telecom boost its profit, the paper said.
In March, Japan Telecom and ITJ said they would merge on October 1.
A Japan Telecom spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
